attributes.name: Uses large muscles to move & balance own body
attributes.category_information: A younger child may crawl, pull up, and/or walk. An older child may walk on a balance beam, jump over a tree stump, or pull a wagon.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Demonstrates strength & control of head, arms, legs, & trunk

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Explores new body positions & movements, such as rolling, sitting, & crawling

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Moves with increased coordination, with or without adult support

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Demonstrates control in changing body position & movements such as sitting to standing, stooping, running

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Balances with increasing coordination

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Uses non-locomotor skills with increased control and coordination

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Performs activities that require coordination of several large muscle movements

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Demonstrates strength & stamina in participation of physical activities

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Increases muscle strength and gains greater control over large and fine motor development

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Travels within a large group, without bumping into others or falling, while using locomotor skills

attributes.name: Uses large muscles to explore & interact with the environment
attributes.category_information: A younger child may reach for objects in the environment. An older child may climb an outdoor play structure.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Uses body position & posture to explore & interact with environment

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Uses balance & movement to explore & interact with environment

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Uses large motor skills such as running, climbing, throwing, to explore environment

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Experiments with body movement through simple game play and/or dancing to music

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Develops an increasing awareness of body & space; allowing for gradually increasing coordinated movement

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Moves body in relation to objects to effectively perform a task

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Understands directional movement (positioning oneself on top, below, to the side of something or someone)

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Demonstrates running and can easily change directions. Can climb elevated structures with minimal adult support.

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Develops and refines throwing, catching and kicking skills

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Engages in complex movements (skipping, dribbling a ball)

attributes.name: Uses hands & fingers to explore & interact with the environment
attributes.category_information: A younger child may feed and/or dress themselves. An older child may manipulate small toys or objects, or use a pencil to write a story.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Uses hands to explore the properties of materials, such as feeling or shaking objects

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Uses eye-hand coordination to complete simple tasks

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Uses both hands in coordinated ways to engage in play, routines, & self-care

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Uses simple tools to engage in play, routines, & self-care

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Uses eye-hand coordination to perform more complex tasks such as cutting or drawing simple shapes

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Uses pincer grasp with thumb & fingers to manipulate objects

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Uses more complex tools to engage in play

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Demonstrates precision in hand-eye coordinated tasks

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Coordinates the use of both hands

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Performs actions involving opposing hand movements (buttoning clothing, starting and zipping up a zipper)

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Uses tools for writing, drawing, cutting

attributes.name: Uses senses to explore & interact with the environment
attributes.category_information: A younger child may dance to music. An older child may engage in tasting different types of apples or observing changes in nature.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Visually Tracks or reaches for an object

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Explores objects using hands and mouth

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Uses senses to develop a basic understanding of objects and the environment

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Uses information derived from senses to understand and adjust how to interact with objects and the environment

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Uses senses to understand their environment and then can apply simple reasoning to ask questions and learn more about what they just experienced

attributes.name: Expresses, understands, & regulates emotions
attributes.category_information: A younger child may smile when happy or frown when upset. An older child may share that they need space when upset about an event.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Expresses a variety of emotions through sounds, gestures, facial expressions, & movement

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Is comforted by a familiar adult

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Responds to others' emotional expressions, with a shared emotional reaction

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Seeks comfort when needed from familiar adults or engages in self-comforting behaviors

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Expresses a broad range of emotions & begins to manage those emotions with support

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Uses words to describe feelings or emotions that reflect an understanding or awareness of the emotions of others

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Begins to express and notice subtle and/or complex emotions in self & others

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Manages the expression of feelings with minimal guidance

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Values fairness and can consider another's perspective

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Can show self-control over emotional reactions, most of the time

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Identifies and describes the experience of different feelings (such as elation, joy, grief, and rage) and how feelings affect daily functioning

attributes.name: Develops positive relationships with adults
attributes.category_information: A younger child may get excited when a familiar teacher walks into the room. An older child may ask a teacher to play a favorite game with them.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Communicates with familiar adults by using a variety of behaviors such as crying, smiling, pointing, & reaching

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Looks to or seeks help from familiar adults

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Uses familiar adults for reassurance when engaging with new adults

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Shows affection & preference for familiar adults

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Displays enjoyment in interactions with trusted adults

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Initiates interaction with trusted adults

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Asks and answers questions about what an adult says in order to gather additional information or clarify something that is not understood

attributes.name: Develops positive relationships with other children
attributes.category_information: A younger child may cooperatively share space or materials with another child. An older child may play a back and forth game with another child.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Displays interest in, & recognition of, other children

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Participates in simple imitation games

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Participates in simple back-and-forth interactions with another child

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Seeks out other children for social interaction & shows preference for a certain child or children

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Joins in play with other children by taking turns or doing joint activities

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Engages in joint play using coordinated goals, planning, roles, and rules

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Engages in reflection and conversation about past play experiences

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Begins to resolve social conflict & negotiate with peers

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Be able to make friends

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Respects the rights of others

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Has sense of empathy and interest in fairness

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Uses thinking skills and communication to resolve conflict

attributes.name: Develops a sense of identity & belonging
attributes.category_information: A younger child may be intrigued with exploring their hands and feet. An older child may create a self-portrait.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Begins to learn about self through exploration of hands, feet, body, movement, & their capacities

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Shows awareness of own thoughts, feelings, & preferences

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Shows confidence in increasing abilities

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Identifies physical similarities & differences between self & others & makes comparisons

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Recognizes own name

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Identifies self as a member of a family

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Identifies the diversity in human characteristics & how people are similar and different

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Uses labels to describe their own physical characteristics

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Feels a sense of pride, but not superiority about racial and cultural identity

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Learns to recognize injustice and takes action against inequitable behaviors

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Can begin to identify stereotypes and differences within group categories

attributes.name: Manages actions & behaviors
attributes.category_information: A younger child may use self-soothing behaviors. An older child may ask for help with a difficult task.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Shows preference for familiar adults when in distress

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Asks for help or assistance when encountering difficult tasks or situations

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Uses basic strategies for dealing with common conflicts, such as sharing, taking turns, & compromising

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Expresses feelings, needs, and opinions in conflict situations; utilizing adult support as needed.

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Manages the expression of feelings, thoughts, impulses, & behaviors with minimal guidance from adults

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Demonstrates ability to delay gratification.

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Follows adult guidelines & expectations for appropriate behavior

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Understands the importance of making appropriate choices and that they are based on expectations in the classroom/school

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Regulates emotions with minimal adult support, most of the time

attributes.name: Understands & follows rules, routine
attributes.category_information: NOT OBSERVED IN INFANTS. A younger child may wash hands before a meal. An older child may wear a helmet for bike riding.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Participates in daily routines as/when initiated by adult

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Learns and follows some simple rules and routines with adult support

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Aware of, participates in, and follows everyday routines

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Responds to signals when transitioning from one activity to another

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Identifies and follows safety rules

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Understands expectations of fire safety, bus safety, and seatbelt use

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Give examples that show the meaning of the following concepts: authority, fairness, justice and responsibility

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Respects and cares for the classroom environment

attributes.name: Develops increasing care for self, others, & environment
attributes.category_information: NOT OBSERVED IN INFANTS. A child may help to put materials away when making a transition.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Shows interest in, and imitates some personal-care tasks

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Repeats care moments during play

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Participates in personal-care tasks with support

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Cleans up & puts materials away appropriately with adult support

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Completes personal care tasks with increasing independence

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Handles & takes care of classroom materials by using them in appropriate ways

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Responds in caring ways to others

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Expresses concern and support for the needs of others

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Independently cleans up & puts materials away appropriately

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Describes positive ways to show care, consideration, and concern for others

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Maintains a clean working space, with minimal reminders from an adult

attributes.name: Listens to, understands, & responds to communication from others
attributes.category_information: A younger child may make sounds when interacting with an adult or another child. An older child may engage in conversational turn-taking.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Participates in reciprocal interactions by exchanging facial expressions & language sounds

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Shows understanding of some words & phrases by responding to simple questions and/or following one step directions

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Understands and responds (verbally & non-verbally) to increasingly longer sentences, simple questions, & simple stories

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Shows acknowledgement of complex comments or questions

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Is able to attend to longer, multi-turn conversations and respond appropriately

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Listens to others and takes turns speaking about topics and texts under discussion

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Asks and answers questions about what a speaker says.  Can gather and clarify information in order to strengthen comprehension

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Listens to peers and adults  in order to resolve conflict and formulate appropriate questions

attributes.name: Uses verbal & non-verbal communication to express needs, wants, & ideas
attributes.category_information: A younger child may use the sign for "more" during a mealtime. An older child may stand up and share an experience with other children in a large group meeting.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Uses varying ways of communicating interests or needs to others, such as sounds or signs

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Combines words or signs from one or more languages into phrases to communicate needs, wants, or ideas.

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Uses simple sentences and/or signs to communicate needs wants, or ideas.

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Uses language, spoken or sign, for a variety of purposes; providing sufficient details to get needs met and/or to provide clarification

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Speaks audibly & expresses thoughts, feelings, & ideas clearly

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Uses conventions of standard English

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Talks about the characters and what happened in a story or poem, with help from adults

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Tells what they think (their opinion) or how they feel about something

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Claps or moves in ways that match the rhythm of a poem or song

attributes.name: Understands & uses a growing vocabulary
attributes.category_information: A younger child may point to a picture of a cat when an adult uses that word. An older child may begin to understand categories of words such as cat, dog, bird, fish are all animals.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Looks at familiar people or objects when they are named

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Uses signs or verbalizations for familiar people or objects.

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Responds appropriately to the meaning of words or signs used by adults

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Imitates new words & uses an increasing number of words in communication

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Comprehends an increasing number of words or signs; particularly those used in daily activities & asks questions about word meanings

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Understands most positional words

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Demonstrates an understanding of word categories, shared characteristics of words & word meanings, & the ability to distinguish between similar words

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Use words and phrases like left, far, in front of, and between to explain where people, animals, and things are

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Use words and phrases like before, afternoon, next week, and long ago to explain when events happened or will happen

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Use knowledge of English grammar and vocabulary in both speech and writing

attributes.name: Understands & uses social & conversational rules
attributes.category_information: A younger child may babble back to an adult as they are being spoken to. An older child may ask follow up questions after having read a story.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Participates in serve and return conversations with non-verbal facial expressions, sounds, & gestures

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Asks simple questions using gestures, signs, and/or words with variation in pitch and intonation

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Seeks information & meaning by asking questions in a variety of ways

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Participates in simple conversations; maintained by back-and-forth exchanges of ideas or information

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Maintains multi-turn conversations with adults, children, & groups by responding in sophisticated ways, such as asking related questions or expressing agreement

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Participates in conversations appropriately based on group size and expectations

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Uses words to resolve conflicts, solve problems, or negotiate with peers

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Asks original and complex questions

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Talks in a group, shares information, and express feelings

attributes.name: Demonstrates phonological awareness
attributes.category_information: A younger child may experiment with repeating sounds like "bababa". An older child may be able to identify the first letter of a word based on the sound they hear... "Flower starts with the letter... F!"

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Vocalizes sounds & experiments with common first sounds such as "mama" or "baba".

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Repeats particularly pleasing sounds

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Recognizes familiar sounds

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Demonstrates rhyme recognition

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Produces beginning sounds in spoken words when prompted & with support, if needed

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Identifies word groups sharing an initial sound

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Knows the sounds associated with most letters

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Identifies, blends, & segments syllables in spoken words

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Develops auditory discrimination skills

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Recognizes similar and different sounds

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Identifies rhyming words

attributes.name: Demonstrates knowledge of print & alphabet
attributes.category_information: NOT OBSERVED IN INFANTS. A younger child may make up words based on groupings of letter. An older child may begin to put groupings of letters together to write words and sentences.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Demonstrates a beginning understanding that print carries meaning

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Distinguishes print from pictures

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Understands that letters are symbols

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Understands written words are made up of a group of individual letters

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Recognizes & names some letters of the alphabet, including letters in own name

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Names most letters (identifying more uppercase, than lower case letters)

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Demonstrates an understanding of basic conventions of print

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Understands & uses clusters of letters to represent words.

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Identifies one's own printed name and the names of others, with minimal adult support

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Identifies some basic sight words

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Demonstrates awareness that letters hold individual speech sounds

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Begins to sound-out short words

attributes.name: Understands & interacts with books and text
attributes.category_information: A younger child may hold a book and pretend to read and/or turn the pages. An older child may begin to read simple words and sentences.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Shows interest in books, pictures, songs, & rhymes

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Actively participates in book reading & storytelling; holding book & turning pages

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Points to familiar pictures in books.

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Asks & answers questions about main characters & events in familiar stories

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Demonstrates an understanding of the meaning of stories and information in books

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Begins to point to simple words while reading simple, memorized texts

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Identifies book parts & features

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Tells stories using a sequence of three connected events

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Demonstrates an understanding of the differences between fantasy & reality

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Talks about facts and the main idea of a text

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Tells a story to an adult while the adult writes it down

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Draws pictures to show what happens in the story

attributes.name: Uses writing for a variety of purposes
attributes.category_information: NOT OBSERVED IN INFANTS. A younger child may begin to use crayons to make scribbles on paper. An older child may make a sign to preserve a block structure they have made.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Attends to and shows interest while adults (or others) write

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Makes marks on paper to explore crayons, paint, and other materials

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Makes scribbles or simple shapes to represent objects or actions

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Shows interest in using writing materials, imitating adults' use

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Makes letter-like marks on paper

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Progressively uses drawing & letter-like forms to intentionally convey meaning

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Writes or draws for a variety of purposes and demonstrates evidence of many aspects of print conventions

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Writes letters in first and last name using upper case letter and lower case letters

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Writes letters and words to label or to tell a story about one's own picture

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Writes using invented spelling, demonstrating some knowledge of association between letter and sound

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Begins to use technology to create simple text and drawings

attributes.name: Observes, explores, & describes their environment to gain understanding of people, places, & things
attributes.category_information: A younger child may put a toy in their mouth to explore its properties. An older child may use a microscope to get a closer look at a leaf they found outside.

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Experiments with everyday objects & materials to answer what, why, or how questions

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Uses the five senses to observe objects, materials, & events

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Represents observable phenomena through drawing

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Begins to use scientific vocabulary

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Asks questions that can be answered through investigation

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Plans & implements investigations & experiments

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Uses scientific practice words or signs such as observe, predict, experiment, & measure

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Identifies the five senses & uses them to make observations

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Uses tools & technology to extend observations.

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Represents observable phenomena with pictures, diagrams, & 3D models

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Uses various sources of information in research, discussion, and inquiry

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Explains how various peoples and cultures in the United States celebrate their histories (like with holidays)

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Asks questions about the natural world

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Independently seeks information. Asks why, what, how, what if questions when exploring materials

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Develops sequence of questions based on investigations: Do worms sleep?  Where do they go when it snows?

attributes.name: Compares & categorizes objects, materials, events
attributes.category_information: NOT OBSERVED IN INFANTS. A younger child may put all of the blue blocks in a pile and all of the red blocks in a pile. An older child may use a tape measure to evaluate how many inches tall they are in comparison to the other children.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Collects or gathers like objects (e.g. leaves, sticks, blocks)

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Matches objects by similar characteristics

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Sorts objects into groups based on simple attributes such as color, shape, & size

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Uses simple measurement tools to quantify similarities & differences

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Orders objects by measurable attributes

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Identifies characteristics of people & things.

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Uses standard & non-standard measurement to observe & compare (objects, materials, and events)

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Sorts objects into groups based on complex attributes such as weight, texture, or sound

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Uses comparative language

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Discovers how people and events from the past relate to the present

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Explains how maps and globes are similar and different. Make maps, drawings, or models to show how familiar places (like the school)

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Solves problems using the skills and tools of engineers and scientists

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Classifies objects with two or more characteristics (red, square blocks)

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Uses one-to-one correspondence as a strategy

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Arranges objects in order by height, size, weight, most, least etc.

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Articulates comparisons among objects

attributes.name: Demonstrates an understanding of cause-and-effect
attributes.category_information: A younger child may repeatedly drop a toy to see what happens. An older child may make a prediction about what will happen on the next page of a story.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Repeats an action to make things happen or to get an adult to repeat an action

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Engages in purposeful actions to cause things to happen

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Makes simple predictions about what will happen next (in a story or in daily routines and play)

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Draws conclusions, constructs explanations, & verbalizes cause & effect relationships

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Explores how things change depending on a variable (e.g. temperature)

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Compares what happens when objects are pushed or pulled in different ways

attributes.name: Uses reasoning & problem-solving skills
attributes.category_information: A younger child may crawl over to the other side of the room to retrieve a toy they want to play with. An older child may look to find an answer to a question in a book in the library.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Uses body movements & actions to solve simple problems and/or explore environment

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Uses a variety of simple strategies to try to solve problems

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Engages in simple investigations & experiments

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Makes simple scientific predictions

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Solves problems based on past experiences or by devising a plan

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Can articulate reasoning for actions and/or solutions.

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Analyzes & interprets data

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Gathers information about a question using observation, books, & technology

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Shows interest in common instruments for measuring (e.g. height, weight, length, temperature)

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Arranges objects from shortest to longest, shortest to tallest, lightest to heaviest

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Compares three or more things using some comparison words appropriately (e.g. small, smallest). Estimates and measure using non-standard measurement tools.

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Collects data and makes records using lists or graphs

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Develops hypotheses and conclusions, makes predictions

attributes.name: Demonstrates an understanding of number names, order, & quantity
attributes.category_information: A younger child may use the sign for "more" when wanting more food at lunch. An older child may count to 20 or more in sequence without missing any numbers.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Attends to quantity in play with objects, such as reaching or looking for more than one object

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Uses simple signs to refer to quantity such as "more"

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Uses basic words to refer to quantity such as "more" and "all gone"

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Begins to use basic number words

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Uses fingers to show how old they are

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Identifies "more" or "less" with a small number of items without needing to count them

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Says or signs number words in sequence (up to 10)

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Develops an understanding of whole numbers

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Shows an understanding of 1:1 correspondence

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Says or signs number words in sequence (up to 20)

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Recognizes small quantities of up to five objects and says or signs the number

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Understands that the last number said represents the number of objects in a set

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Utilizes & uses numbers related to order & position (up to 10th)

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Recognizes, names, and writes numerals 0-20

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Counts to 100 by ones or tens, starting from any number

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Explains that numbers in the "teens" (11- 19) are made of a ten and some ones

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Creates groups of 10 with manipulatives

attributes.name: Demonstrates an understanding of shapes, spatial sense, & patterns
attributes.category_information: A younger child may watch an adult as they move from one side of the room to the other. An older child may be able to recite the names of advanced shapes like an octagon, and tell you how many sides it has.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Explores or examines objects & watches when they move

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Shows awareness when an object is not in its usual place

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Explores & discovers how things move through space and/or fit together

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Demonstrates awareness of size

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Explores & completes simple puzzles

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Recognizes simple patterns

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Recognizes & names simple shapes

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Understands simple spatial vocabulary

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Fills in missing elements of patterns

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Creates, identifies, extends, & duplicates simple patterns with objects, numbers, sounds, & movement

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Names & describes a greater number of shapes, and does so using length, number of sides, & angles

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Analyzes, compares & sorts 2D and 3D shapes & objects.

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Understands & uses directional vocabulary

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Names, describes, analyzes, and compares shapes like squares, circles, triangles, rectangles, hexagons, cubes, cones, cylinders, and spheres

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Identifies shared two-dimensional shapes as well as diamonds, ovals, etc.

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Identifies existing visual and oral patterns (e.g. AB, ABC, AAB, ABB)

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Copies and extends existing visual and oral patterns

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Creates new visual and oral patterns

attributes.name: Demonstrates an understanding of simple operations
attributes.category_information: NOT OBSERVED IN INFANTS OR TODDLERS. A younger child may be able to state how many children may play in an interest area based on the number of children they observe there in that moment. An older child may be able to use tally marks to keep track of the score in a simple game.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Begins to show understanding of math terms such as more than, less than, difference, all together, or take away

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Manipulates objects to achieve a goal (i.e. giving one more napkin so everyone has one, or removing a chair to have the correct number)

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Begins to add & subtract small collections of objects, with support

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Represents addition & subtraction in different way (fingers, objects, drawings)

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Solves simple addition & subtraction word problems

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Finds the number that makes 10 for any number 1-9, with minimal adult support. For example, 6 needs 4 to make 10.

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Breaks numbers into smaller numbers, with minimal adult support, for example, 5 is made of 2 and 3 or 4 and 1.

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Uses math to make arguments about why something is true or false

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Adds and subtracts with numbers up to five, with minimal adult support

attributes.name: Uses imitation & symbolic representation in play
attributes.category_information: A younger child may be able to play peek-a-boo with an adult; imitating the hand motions. An older child may take on the role of cashier during a game of supermarket in the dramatic play area.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Engages in reciprocal imitation games

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Imitates the earlier actions of others

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Uses toy objects in ways that are similar to the real objects they represent

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Imitates complex or multi-step actions of others

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Acts out routines or social roles

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Uses objects as symbols to represent other objects

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Improvises with props during dramatic play

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Uses symbols to represent thinking in play

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Participates cooperatively in complex pretend play, with predetermined roles & plans

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Visualizes environments and arranges the physical playing space to communicate mood, time, and locale

attributes.name: Maintains focus & sustains attention
attributes.category_information: A younger child may follow the movement and sound of a wind chime. An older child may work on a building structure over the span of several days until it is completed.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Attends to auditory and visual stimuli

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Maintains focus & attention on a simple task or activity for short periods of time with adult support

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Maintains focus & attention on a simple task or activity for short periods of time independently

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Maintains focus & attention on more complex tasks or activities over extended periods of times (days or weeks)

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Span of attention increases; works at task for longer periods of time

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Is able to pay attention and is not distracted by sounds not noticed by others

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Attends to a group story or activity for 15 to 20 minutes

attributes.name: Ability to remember information to use in later tasks
attributes.category_information: A younger child may smile or squeal when their parent arrives to pick them up for the day. An older child may be able to play a memory matching game with success.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Recognizes familiar people, places, and things

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Recalls singular details to a story, activity, or event

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Holds small amounts of information in mind to follow and complete two-step directions

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Recounts details to a story or experience in order

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Holds increasing amounts of information in mind to follow & complete multi-step directions

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Recalls the main idea and some details of the story/discussion, with minimal adult support

attributes.name: Demonstrates flexibility in thoughts, actions, & behavior
attributes.category_information: NOT OBSERVED IN INFANTS. A younger child may be able to put materials away in preparation to go outside. An older child may be able to have a conversation with another child about what to do when they both want to use the same materials.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Demonstrates the ability to transition from one task or activity to another with consistent adult support

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Regularly transitions from one task or activity to another with intermittent adult support

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Utilizes more than one strategy to complete work and/or solve a simple problem

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Successfully transitions from one task or activity to another independently

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Utilizes multiple strategies to complete work and/or solve increasingly complex problems without adult support

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Understands concepts, such as simple time markers (today, tomorrow, yesterday)

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Talks self through steps required in simple problem solving situations

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Is able to cope with an unexpected change, most of the time

attributes.name: Demonstrates persistence in actions & behaviors
attributes.category_information: A child may attend to a simple puzzle until they are able to get every single piece to fit correctly.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Repeats simple actions to achieve a goal

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Stays engaged in an activity to successfully complete a simple task

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Engages in an activity to successfully complete more complex tasks for increasingly longer amounts of time

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Engages in activities to successfully complete tasks from beginning to end, despite potential challenges or obstacles

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Is highly involved and persistent in problem solving; tries alternative methods when needed. Seek answers through reflection; asks for help when needed.

attributes.name: Demonstrates use of creativity & imagination in learning & play
attributes.category_information: NOT OBSERVED IN INFANTS. A younger child may pretend a block is a telephone by holding it up to their ear and talking. An older child may take on character roles during dramatic play (family members, store clerk, story characters, etc.

progression_points.title: Emerging
progression_points.description: Uses objects and materials in novel ways during play

progression_points.title: Developing
progression_points.description: Experiments with more than one material or approach when engaged in an activity or solitary/independent play

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Uses pretend or imaginary objects in social play

progression_points.title: Progressing
progression_points.description: Takes on the role of another ("I'm the mommy")

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Uses objects and materials in increasingly innovative ways

progression_points.title: Advancing
progression_points.description: Engages in inventive social play

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Engages in elaborate and extended role-play

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Uses props in play to create complex scenarios

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Designs and constructs with blocks and other three-dimensional materials

progression_points.title: Refining
progression_points.description: Draws, paints, and uses multi-media to create representations with many details
